intro: Tripogandra stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tripogandra, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and prefers well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Tripogandra stenophylla is often found in open, sunny areas and is relatively drought-tolerant.
